content: (U) The fact that the ODNI manages the budget for the National Intelligence Program (NIP)
(U) The aggregate or "top line" amount of funds appropriated by Congress to the National Intelligence Program for fiscal years 2007 and beyond.
remarks: (U) Only applicable from 2007 and later. Previous top line budget amounts remain classified. (See * below. Contact ODNI/CFO for additional guidance as needed.)

content: (U) The aggregate or "top line" amount of funds requested and approved by Congress for the DoD Military Intelligence Program (MIP) for fiscal years 2007 through 2014.
remarks: (U) Any subsidiary information concerning the intelligence budget, whether the information concerns particular intelligence agencies or particular intelligence programs is classified and will not be disclosed. Information below the top-line figure may cause harm to the national security. The only exception to the foregoing are for unclassified appropriations, primarily for the Community Management Account.

content: (U) Budget or financial information directly tied to the NIP, below the aggregate or top line amount for all fiscal years.
remarks:
(U) No other MIP budget figures or program details will be released, as they remain classified for national security reasons.
(U) Minimum SECRET//NOFORN. May be compartmented based on intelligence functional manager/OCA decision. Refer to appropriate intelligence program classification guide.

content: (U) ODNI financial information inclusive of budget, personnel, expenditure, and appropriations data, to include related guidance, procedures, agreements, or disbursement techniques associated with ODNI administrative operations or projects/activities below the Directorate or Mission Manager level.
remarks:
(U) Unclassified, so long as the release of such information will not lead to knowledge of or insight into an intelligence community mission, sensitive program, target, vulnerability, capability, or intelligence source and method or budget information for any IC component - including the ODNI.
(U) Example: Overall budget of administrative functions for ODNI/HR, CHCO or PAO etc., is FOUO.

content: (U) Specific information regarding ODNI or IC agency Directorate or Mission Manager-level fiscal matters inclusive of budget, expenditure, funding, and appropriations data, to include related guidance, procedures, agreements, or disbursement techniques, the release of which would provide the level of effort committed or insight into capabilities or intelligence sources or methods.

(U) Detailed information regarding ODNI and IC fiscal matters inclusive of budget, manpower, expenditures, funding, and appropriations data, to include related guidance, procedures, agreements, vulnerabilities, or disbursement techniques related to the National Intelligence Program (NIP), or the financial condition and resources of the IC as a whole.
remarks: (U) A higher classification or additional markings may be required for compartmented information or programs. Consult with appropriate Program Compartment Guide or NCIX for compartmented info.

content: (U) The fact that ODNI has an active recruitment, assessment, selection, and evaluation process to hire ODNI staff.
(U) The fact that an overt employee (including their name) works for the ODNI as a staff person, detailee, or contractor.
(U) General information regarding ODNI staff recruitment, assessment, selection, and evaluation process.
(U) Specific information concerning ODNI staff recruitment, assessment, selection, and evaluation of applicants that reveals information which would allow this process to be circumvented.

(U) General information concerning ODNI workforce, mission areas and administrative functions that do not describe the workforce structure in any detail or include, names, titles, assignments or locations.
(U) Total number of ODNI or IC staff employees authorized or assigned.
remarks:
(U) Does not include:
Specific number of staff, government and contractors in the operational areas (i.e., IARPA, DDII, NIC, NCTC, NCPC, ONCIX, NIEMA, NIM staffs, and the IC CIO), implying priorities and scope, providing insight into sensitive aspects of operational or sensitive missions areas. Resource totals.
(U) When in doubt, contact DNI-Classification for guidance.

content: (U) Specific information concerning the existing or planned ODNI (or IC) workforce below the Mission Manager-level that describes the workforce structure including names, resource numbers, assignments or locations, which identifies an organization size and capability, or identifies the resources dedicated to an intelligence objective or geographical area.
remarks:
(U) Includes organizational charts where resource numbers can be deduced for the operational elements within the ODNI.
(U) Classified (notional) example:
ONCIX is comprised of 19 staff and 798 contractors working CI and Security related issues.
NCTC is authorized 500 staff billets, and 400 contractors to execute CT functions on behalf of the USG.
- DDII has 122 employees assigned.
(U) When in doubt, contact DNI-Classification for guidance.

content: (U) Resource numbers (staff and/or contractor) covering non-operational ODNI elements, such as P&S, PE,
remarks:
(U) FOUO (notional) example:
- MSD/HR has 12 staff and 23 contractors.

content: (U) The aggregate listing of names and official titles of ODNI employees.
remarks:
- IC IG has 32 employees assigned.
- SRA has 10 staff and 3 detailees assigned.
(U) When in doubt, contact DNI-Classification for guidance.

content: (U) The aggregate listing of names and official titles of IC employees.
remarks: Only applicable from 2007 and later.

content: (U) The fact that ODNI Headquarters is located within the Liberty Crossing Compound in the Tyson's Corner Area of Virginia.
remarks: (U) Including the physical address of ODAMI.

content: (U) The fact that ODNI operates in facilities other than Liberty Crossing.
(U) The name and abbreviation of a specific overt ODNI location in the Washington Metropolitan Area.
remarks: (U) May be FOUO do to aggregation.

content: (U) The association of the ODNI with a covert location.
remarks: (U) Refer to specific (covert) agency classification guidance for additional details.

content: (U) The names and abbreviations of ODNI locations in the Washington Metropolitan Area, both overt and covert.

(U) Individually unclassified or controlled unclassified data items that in the compilation or aggregation would provide insight into ODNI's or IC's organization, functions, staffing, activities, capabilities, vulnerabilities, or intelligence sources or methods.
remarks:
(U) May be REL TO USA, FVEY depending on the issue. Contact ODNI Partner Engagement (ODNI/PE) for guidance.

(U) Example 1. Work products must be examined from an outsider's perspective to ensure adversaries cannot derive classified information from various unclassified sources. Unclassified "puzzle pieces" can sometimes be assembled to form a classified "picture" or unintentionally paint a red X on a weak spot in your ability to perform or maintain your mission at acceptable levels.

(U) Example 2: Unclassified budget information could be paired with other unclassified acquisition or requirements information to show an agency's vulnerability or shortfall in protection mechanisms for IT or physical security systems.

(U) Example 3: We would not want our adversaries to know that we did not properly budget to provide 24/7 police coverage of the entry points to the facility or to purchase necessary equipment to secure all building entry points. These vulnerabilities could be exploited to gain access to the building.

content: (U) Fact/existence of the Office of the Director of National Intelligence (ODNI).
(U) Fact that the Director of National Intelligence (DNI) serves as the head of the Intelligence Community (IC).
(U) The ODNI senior position titles, acronyms and abbreviations.
(U) Fact that DNI serves as principal advisor to the President; the National Security Council, and Homeland Security Council for intelligence matters related to the national security.
(U) Fact that DNI directs the implementation of the US government's National Intelligence Program (NIP) and special activities as directed by the President.
(U) ODNI organization charts that provide the existing or planned structure, positions and names assigned at the DNI, PDDNI, CMO, and/or DDNI/II level and one level below.
remarks: (U) Includes Chiefs of Staff, Executive-level Offices, Directorates, Centers, Administration, and Mission Managers.

content: (U) Organization charts that provide specific details on the existing or planned structure of ODNI administrative, support or non-operational areas which include names, resource numbers, assignments or locations
remarks:
(U) Includes: P&S, PE, AT&F, SRA, CHCO, CFO, CIO/IMD, ISE, OGC, CLPO, PAO, IC IG, EEOD and OLA, etc.
(U) When in doubt, contact DNI-Classification for guidance.

content: (U) Organization charts that provide specific details on the existing or planned structure of ODNI operational components at the third organizational level and below to include names, resource numbers, assignments or locations.
remarks:
(U) Includes: IARPA, DDII, NIC, NCTC, NCPC, ONCIX, NIEMA, NIM staffs, and the IC CIO, etc.
(U) When in doubt, contact DNI-Classification for guidance.

content: (U) Fact that ODNI employs CIA, FBI, NSA, DHS, DOS or other USG agency personnel (permanent staff or detailees) within the LX Compound, with no other details.
remarks:
(U) Does not include
U//FOUO.

content: (U) The fact that there are NIMs dedicated to specific countries or areas of responsibility.
(U) The fact that NIMs produce Unifying Intelligence Strategies (UIS).
(U) The fact that that NIMs produce UIS' for Counterterrorism (CT) and Counterproliferation (CP).
(U) The fact of a named regionally or functionally focused UIS, other than Counterterrorism or Counterproliferation.
remarks:
(U//FOUO) Example:
is U//FOUO.

content: (U) The fact of a UIS that focuses on a named country.
remarks:
(U//FOUO) Example:
is U//FOUO.

content: (U) The fact of a UIS that focuses on a named topic, a component thereof, lone actor or non-state actor.
remarks: (U) Classification may be higher depending on the specific topic or named actor.

content: (U) General information regarding an overt contract that does not provide insight into capabilities, vulnerabilities, or intelligence sources or methods.
remarks: (LJ) May require PROPIN or be Contract Sensitive.

content: (U) Specific details regarding a contract, to include the fact of the affiliation between contractor and customer.
remarks:
(U) Includes contracts.
(U) Refer to appropriate procurement agency for guidance.

content: (U) Specific details regarding a contract, to include the fact of the affiliation between contractor and customer.
remarks:
(U//FOUO) See contact for current guidance.
(U) Includes specific information pertaining to covert contracting procedures.
(U) Refer to appropriate procurement agency for guidance.

content: (U) General information on analytic methodologies for sensitive data sets.
(U) Intelligence analysis that provides general information regarding sensitive or classified collection systems or data sets, or intelligence sources and methods.
remarks: (U) May contain compartmented information. Refer to appropriate Program Security Officer / Program Security Guide for additional information.

content: (U) Intelligence analysis that provides specific information regarding sensitive or classified collection systems or data sets, or intelligence sources and methods.

(U) Intelligence analysis that provides specific information regarding sensitive or classified collection systems or data sets, or intelligence sources and methods which if revealed, would nullify or measurably reduce their effectiveness.
remarks: (U) Contact ODNI Partner Engagement (ODNI/PE) for foreign disclosure guidance.

content: (U) Fact that ODNI relies on the results of IC collection sources and methods in protecting our National Security.

(U) Information regarding the management activities of a collection program or system that is not associated with a specific collection mission and does not provide any precision or enumeration specific to that mission.
remarks: (U) Includes program organization, management, business processes, relationships, coordination, and oversight. Refer to applicable agency or program classification guide for more detailed guidance.

content: (U) Information concerning IC collection and content acquisition capabilities aimed at foreign media and other publicly available material where disclosure could be detrimental to US collection efforts.

(U) Information describing or derived from a US or foreign collection system, program, requirement, or research and development (R&D) effort where disclosure would reveal general US or foreign collection capability, or interest.
remarks: (U) Includes program organization, management, business processes, relationships, coordination, and oversight. Refer to applicable agency or program classification guide for more detailed guidance.

content: (U) Information describing or derived from a US or foreign collection system, program, requirement, or R&D effort where disclosure would hinder US collection.
remarks: (U) Contact ODNI Partner Engagement (ODNI/PE) for foreign disclosure guidance.

content: (U) Information describing or derived from a US or foreign collection system, program, requirement, or R&D effort where disclosure would lessen US intelligence or collection advantage.
remarks: (U) Contact ODNI Partner Engagement (ODNI/PE) for foreign disclosure guidance.

content: (U) Information describing or derived from a US or foreign collection system, program, requirement, or R&D effort where disclosure would reveal specific US or foreign collection capability, interest, or vulnerability.
remarks: (U) Contact ODNI Partner Engagement (ODNI/PE) for foreign disclosure guidance.

content: (U) Information describing or derived from a US or foreign collection system, program, requirement, or R&D effort where disclosure would result in loss of US collection.
remarks: (U) Contact ODNI Partner Engagement (ODNI/PE) for foreign disclosure guidance.

content: (U) Information describing or derived from a US or foreign collection system, program, requirement, or R&D effort where disclosure would reveal specific US or foreign collection capability, interest, or vulnerability, result in loss of US collection, and/or negate US intelligence or collection advantage.
remarks: (U) Contact ODNI Partner Engagement (ODNI/PE) for foreign disclosure guidance.

content: (U) The fact that NCTC uses FISA-acquired and FISA-derived information in its analysis and in its intelligence products.
remarks: (U) UNCLASSIFIED when used generically.

content: (U) Information obtained by, or derived from, an investigative technique requiring a FISA Court order or other FISA authorized collection ("FISA Information").
remarks: (U) May be classified higher based on individual collection agency or assisting agency classification guidance.

content: (U) Use of FISA-acquired and FISA-derived information when connected to a particular target or analytic judgment in intelligence products or analysis.
remarks: (U) May be classified higher based on individual collection agency classification guidance.

content: (S//NF) The fact of NCTC's access to and use of raw, unminimized FISA-acquired information.
(S//NF) The process and procedures of making raw, unminimized FISA-acquired information available to NCTC personnel.
(S//NF) NCTC's Standard Minimization Procedures.
(S//NF) The policies, process, and procedures for implementing NCTC's Standard Minimization Procedures.
(S//NF) The fact that NCTC employees are required to sign a Letter of Consent to View and Work with Objectionable Material in order to access unminimized FISA acquired information.
(U//FOUO) The fact of the existence of the FISA Source Registry.
(U//FOCO) The fact that all products that contain FISA-derived information must include the NCTC FISA caveat.
(U) The NCTC FISA caveat.
(U) Budget or finance information to support the NCTC FISA program.
(U) The fact that NCTC has a FISA Coordinator (FC) who serves as the focal point for managing the implementation of NCTC's FISA authorities and responsibilities.
(U) The general description of the FISA Coordinator's responsibilities.
remarks: (S//NF) May be classified higher when the information includes a reference to NCTC's raw, unminimized FISA authorities and processes.

content: (U) The fact that NCTC has individuals who function as FISA Analysts or FISA Advanced Analysts.
remarks: (U) May be classified higher when associated with a description of the FISA Analyst role and corresponding data accesses.

content: (S//NF) The fact that NCTC has individuals who function as FISA Minimization Approvers.
(U) The fact that NCTC has individuals who function as FISA Dissemination Nominators.
remarks: (U) May be classified higher when associated with a description of the FISA Dissemination Nominator role and corresponding data accesses.

content: (U) The fact that NCTC has individuals who function as FISA Dissemination Approvers.
remarks: (U) May be classified higher when associated with a description of the FISA Dissemination Approver role and corresponding data accesses.

content: (U) The fact that NCTC has individuals who function as FISA Notification Points of Contact (POCs)
remarks: (U) May be classified higher when associated with a description of the FISA Notification POC role and corresponding data accesses.

content: (U) The fact that NCTC has individuals who function as FISA Auditors.
remarks: (U) May be classified higher when associated with a description of the FISA Auditor role and corresponding data accesses.

content: (U) The fact that NCTC has individuals who function as FISA Systems Administrators.
remarks: (U) May be classified higher when associated with a description of the FISA System Administrator role and corresponding data accesses.

content: (U//foue) Descriptions of the various FISA roles and corresponding data accesses.
remarks: (S//NF) Applies to the FISA Analyst, FISA Advanced Analyst, Minimization Approver, Dissemination Nominator, Dissemination Approver, Notification POC, FISA Auditor, FISA System Administrator roles.

content: (U//FOUO)
remarks: (U) May be classified higher if this information is associated with the specifics of particular types of audits and their results.

content: (U//FOUO) The fact that NCTC audits and reports on all searches of FISA data
remarks: (U) May be classified higher if this information is associated with the results of the audits.

content: (S/ANF) The fact that NCTC audits and reports on all
(S/ANF) The fact that NCTC audits and reports on all
(S/ANF) The fact that NCTC audits and reports on all
(S//NF) The fact that NCTC audits and reports on all
